thing-type.label: RGBWE2 RGBW Bulb V2
thing-type.description: RGBW Bulb V2<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtZipato Bulb 2 has 5 color channels available for you to adjust: RED, GREEN, BLUE, WARM WHITE and COLD WHITE. Zipato Bulb 2 can be used to add color to your home or just to lighten it up in any white color tone you desire. By using Zipatile or Zipabox (or other Z-Wave) home controller, you can control the bulb from anywhere in the world, by using any smartphone (iOS or Android). Also, you can automatically set colors of your Zipato Bulb 2 to indicate events using the Zipato rule creator.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtScrew the Zipato Bulb 2 into the socket.</li&gt <li&gtTurn on the bulb with your wall switch to apply power to the bulb.- If you’re not using a wall switch, then use your alternate method to apply power to the bulb.</li&gt <li&gtActivate inclusion mode on your Z-wave controller- This may also be done through your associated application,if your ecosystem has that capability.</li&gt <li&gtToggle the wall-switch, from OFF, then to ON.- Or use your alternate method to toggle power to the bulb from OFF, then to ON.</li&gt <li&gtThe bulb will flash once if it has been successfully included into your Z-Wave network.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtScrew the Zipato Bulb 2 into the socket.</li&gt <li&gtTurn on the bulb with your wall switch to apply power to the bulb.- If you’re not using a wall switch, then use your alternate method to apply power to the bulb.</li&gt <li&gtActivate exclusion mode on your Z-wave controller- This may also be done through your associated application,if your ecosystem has that capability.</li&gt <li&gtToggle the wall-switch, from OFF, then to ON.- Or use your alternate method to toggle power to the bulb from OFF, then to ON.</li&gt <li&gtThe bulb will flash once if it has been successfully excluded from your Z-Wave network.</li&gt </ol&gt
